intro: Beyeriopsis lepidopetala, commonly known as the velvet-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The leaves are velvety and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its common name. It typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Beyeriopsis lepidopetala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
